channel.title: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'
channel.description:
Originally, when you post a post that is over 20,000 characters, you can copy the few thousand at the end and post it as a reply to your own topic. The 'double post merger' mod was intelligent enough to create a new reply, instead of creating a post that's over 20,000 characters. However, with the current system, you are unable to post any topic over 20,000 characters and you are unable to reply twice in your own topic. The only workaround is asking for someone to post in your topic, simply to remove it to link the posts together (quite an inconvenience).
I request that the system be modified to detect super large posts and allow immediate replies.

item.title: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Koolvin, post:26, topic:329857”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=426240.msg3158059#msg3158059 date=1269210453]

If only Taharok and Tico go over 20,000 then it’s pretty clear we don’t need it.

Occasionally I make a long post but never have I gone over the limit. I think if you do this regularly you either need to get yourself a blog and you can just link to your big “tutorials” or you should learn to write in a more concise and coherent manner.

It’s mainly because of large code blocks that the limit gets exceeded.

Well the answer is even more simple, why not use pastebins?

If this site had its own you could even integrate it with the forum so you could reference posts with code links.
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'

Occasionally I make a long post but never have I gone over the limit. I think if you do this regularly you either need to get yourself a blog and you can just link to your big “tutorials” or you should learn to write in a more concise and coherent manner.

It’s mainly because of large code blocks that the limit gets exceeded.
[/quote]

Well the answer is even more simple, why not use pastebins?

If this site had its own you could even integrate it with the forum so you could reference posts with code links.[/quote]

sanga282:

lies i was going to post a tutorial on configuring utorrent as Ron said about it one of those threads, its 50,000 chars and i cant publish it

At some point you confront the reality that the majority of the rules people expect you to follow were instated by morons and give up any pretense of trying to follow them. http://www.hidetext.net/

item.title: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I don’t really see a reason a post should exceed 20,000 characters myself, can anyone enlighten me? I can try to have a look at the mod and see what can be done, however.

In the past I have made several posts over that limit. So it would probably be a good idea to implement such an idea.

Read full topic
item.source: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'

item.title: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:329857”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=426240.msg3131303#msg3131303 date=1266530041]
If you really want examples, I have several posts throughout the 2 1/2 years of me being here that required more than one post. Sometimes the need arises to go very in-depth about a particular topic, such that you need over 20,000 characters to bring the topic across.
[/quote]

I saw the post you were referring to, which confirmed what I thought, that posting code in the new Geshi code tags is the cause of needing more characters. You could solve that by attaching the java files to the post, instead of pasting them in there, but then I guess that would defeat the purpose of the syntax highlighting.[/quote]
Just exclude code tags from the character count, problem sovled…

Read full topic
item.source: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'

item.title: 'No double post' yet 'post cannot exceed 20000 characters'
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Taharok:

If you really want examples, I have several posts throughout the 2 1/2 years of me being here that required more than one post. Sometimes the need arises to go very in-depth about a particular topic, such that you need over 20,000 characters to bring the topic across.

I saw the post you were referring to, which confirmed what I thought, that posting code in the new Geshi code tags is the cause of needing more characters. You could solve that by attaching the java files to the post, instead of pasting them in there, but then I guess that would defeat the purpose of the syntax highlighting.

Read full topic

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:329857”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=426240.msg3130891#msg3130891 date=1266475398]
I don’t really see a reason a post should exceed 20,000 characters myself, can anyone enlighten me? I can try to have a look at the mod and see what can be done, however.
[/quote]

It’s not really a problem on this site, but on moparscape there is the occasional tutorial that exceeds 20,000 characters and has previously used to double post mod to fit it all in.[/quote]

Those tutorials don’t have a decent information density, they are not needed.
